title: Young Sheldon Stars Talk Family, Friendship, and Growing Up on Set!
content:
The stars of "Young Sheldon," the popular prequel to "The Big Bang Theory," are opening up about their experiences on the show. Raegan Revord, who plays Missy Cooper, and Montana Jordan, who plays George Cooper Jr., share their insights into their characters, their on-set family, and what it's like to grow up in the spotlight.

Both actors find similarities with their characters. Jordan relates to George's athleticism and messy room, while Revord sees herself in Missy's love-hate relationship with her twin brother. However, Revord's true passion lies in writing fantasy fiction, just like her on-screen sibling Sheldon's love for science. 

Despite their busy schedules, the young actors have managed to forge strong bonds with their castmates, finding a sense of family on set.  Revord credits the show with helping her develop her acting skills, particularly in emotional scenes. Jordan, on the other hand, is taking life one day at a time, enjoying the journey of being a young actor in Los Angeles.
author: Devarsi Ghosh
